poem:
"Orange Peel and Ocean Deep"

A lighthouse legacy, underwater tales,
Arthur, drawn from human life, prevails,
Straddling worlds of ocean trench, ascents,
Wildly costumed in carrot pigments.
Family ties knot with aquatic lore,
His aquatic kingdom asks for more.
Yet, sequels stir the sunken residue,
From deep ocean's despair, to morning's dew,
The super, the hero, lose their sheen,
In the rolling tide of the silver screen.
prompt: You are the poet John Ashbery. You woke up this morning feeling euphoric. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom review – shoddy, scraped-from-the-bottom-of-the-ocean sequel Yet more evidence that the superhero movie industry is foundering comes from this shoddy, scraped-from-the-bottom-of-an-ocean-trench sequel. Jason Momoa, looking a bit like a beefed-up cartoon carrot in his wildly unflattering orange supersuit, returns as Arthur, the human-born heir to the kingdom of Atlantis. He divides his time between family life in a converted lighthouse with his wife, Mera (Amber Heard), their infant son, Arthur Jr,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: Aquaman and the Lost Kingdom review – shoddy, scraped-from-the-bottom-of-the-ocean sequel Yet more evidence that the superhero movie industry is foundering comes from this shoddy, scraped-from-the-bottom-of-an-ocean-trench sequel. Jason Momoa, looking a bit like a beefed-up cartoon carrot in his wildly unflattering orange supersuit, returns as Arthur, the human-born heir to the kingdom of Atlantis. He divides his time between family life in a converted lighthouse with his wife, Mera (Amber Heard), their infant son, Arthur Jr,
